<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The decrease in total exploration expenditures from $11,056,629 during 2013 to $6,668,949 during 2014 resulted in part from our cutting back on exploration expenditures in the first quarter to focus the majority of its financial and management resources on the Pinion Acquisition. For the remainder of 2014, we also delayed or reduced our planned exploration programs on the Railroad-Pinion Project to coincide with the size and timing of our March 2014 and August 2014 financings.&#160;&#160;In response to very difficult capital markets for exploration projects, management is taking a more conservative approach to designing and carrying out its exploration activities based on the actual timing and net proceeds raised from its financing efforts. During 2014, management also ceased any further exploration expenditures on the Safford-CVN and East Camp Douglas Projects in light of our proposed sale of such assets to Tanqueray.&#160;&#160;See Item&#160;5B
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#8220;Liquidity and Capital Resources - &#8220;Tanqueray LOI.&#8221;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	42
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage54"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	General Exploration Program Practices
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our exploration staff considers the following guidelines when undertaking our exploration activities and determining whether to proceed to an increased level of exploration and development.&#160;&#160;The first step is target identification and land acquisition.&#160;&#160;Next, a phased program is devised for the project in question.&#160;&#160;The phased program consists of:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Phase I- drilling to assess the validity and viability of the individual target areas.&#160;&#160;This may involve drilling of anywhere from 5 to 20 holes depending upon the size, complexity and favorable results from the individual target areas.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Phase II- assessing the economic viability of each individual target identified and determined to be warranted for further drilling. Phase II drilling, now completed, was designed to extend areas of known shallow oxide gold mineralization along strike and at depth, and to test new targets identified by the Phase 1 program.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Phase III- drilling to the point where definition drilling is warranted.&#160;&#160;The purpose of this drilling is to provide sufficient information from the discovered mineral deposit to categorize the economic viability of the deposit and to determine a mine plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In assessing the quality or grade of the drilling discoveries from our exploration activities, certain Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QA/QC) protocols are employed.&#160;&#160;Weighted averaging has been used to calculate all reported drill hole intervals.&#160;&#160;Data are insufficient to determine true widths on mineralized zone. Pulps are digested and analyzed for gold using fire assay fusion and an atomic absorption spectroscopy (AAS) finish on a 30 gram split. All other elements are determined by ICP analysis. QA/QC includes insertion of blanks, duplicates and standards into submitted sample batches. These results are continuously evaluated to insure reliable sample preparation in Elko, Nevada and assayed consistently in Reno, Nevada or Vancouver, B.C.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our exploration staff includes a Chief Geologist who provides technical oversight and has more than 20 years&#8217; experience with other exploration companies in Nevada, a Senior Geologist and a Staff Geologist.&#160;&#160;We also retain consultants and geologists as needed to assist us in different aspects of our exploration program.&#160;&#160;For further information, see Item&#160;6A &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Directors and Senior Management.&#8221;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Government Regulation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Mining operations and exploration activities are subject to various federal, state and local laws and regulations in the United&#160;States, which govern prospecting, development, mining, production, exports, taxes, labor standards, occupational health, waste disposal, protection of the environment, mine safety, hazardous substances and other matters. We have obtained or have pending applications for those licenses, permits or other authorizations currently required to conduct our exploration and other programs. We believe that we are in compliance in all material respects with applicable mining, health, safety and environmental statutes and the regulations passed thereunder in Nevada and the United&#160;States.&#160;&#160;We are not aware of any current orders or directions relating to us with respect to the foregoing laws and regulations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	43
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage55"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Environmental Regulation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our mineral projects are subject to various federal, state and local laws and regulations governing protection of the environment. These laws cover the maintenance of air and water quality standards and land reclamation.&#160;&#160;The laws are continually changing and, in general, are becoming more restrictive, and with increased enforcement and liabilities, including penalties.&#160;&#160;It is our policy to conduct business in a way that safeguards public health and the environment.
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	We have not had any material environmental incidents or non-compliance with any applicable environmental regulations on the properties where our projects are located. We believe that our operations are and will be conducted in material compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Changes to current state or federal laws and regulations in Nevada, where we operate currently, or in jurisdictions where we may operate in the future, could require additional capital expenditures and increased operating and/or reclamation costs. Additional regulatory requirements could impact the economics of our projects. Based upon our current exploration activities, we have not incurred material capital expenditures for environmental control facilities and do not expect to incur any such expenditures in the balance of 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Permitting Regulations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All of our mineral projects are on lands managed by the U.S. Federal Project Bureau of Land Management (BLM), with about 45.3% of the Railroad-Pinion Project on private lands and a portion of the Camp Douglas Project on private lands in the form of patented claims.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Issues of surface disturbance on federally-managed lands are managed according to the amount of disturbance.&#160;&#160;Composite disturbance on non-contiguous sections of land up to a total of five acres falls into a Notice of Intent (NOI) category.&#160;&#160;The term of a NOI is two years, but can be extended through a continuation notification.&#160;&#160;Disturbance consists of road building, cross-country travel, drill site and sump construction and removal of vegetation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For areas where disturbance consists of greater than five acres, a Plan of Operation (POO) is required.&#160;&#160;This is an Environmental Assessment (EA) that can take up to one year to complete.&#160;&#160;Flora, fauna and archeological studies are required for the EA, and are seasonal and access dependent.&#160;&#160;Public scrutiny and review are also required.&#160;&#160;In December 2012, we received approval for our POO from the BLM which allows up to 200 acres of disturbance and provides us with full access to all targets in the northern third of the Railroad-Pinion Project.&#160;&#160;Bonding for disturbance can be obtained through the Nevada State Reclamation Performance Bonding Pool (&#8220;Bonding Pool&#8221;), and can be done in 50 acre increments as needed up to the 200 total acreage.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To date, we have not encountered permitting impediments on any of our Projects.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Nevada Laws
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	At the state level, exploration operations in Nevada are regulated by the Nevada Department of Conservation and Natural Resources, Division of Environmental Protection.&#160;&#160;Nevada state law requires us to hold Nevada Water Pollution Control Permits, which dictate operating controls and closure and post-closure requirements directed at protecting surface and ground water. In addition, we are required to hold Nevada Reclamation Permits. These permits mandate concurrent and post-disturbance reclamation of exploration to mitigate the long-term environmental impact by stabilizing, contouring, resloping and revegetating various portions of the site&#160;&#160;after exploration operations are completed.&#160;&#160;We are required to post reclamation bonds sufficient to guarantee the cost of exploration reclamation. We fulfill the bonding obligation through payments into the Nevada State Bonding Pool.&#160;&#160;Bond monies are returned upon completion and sign-off by appropriate federal and state regulatory agencies of the disturbance reclamation and vegetation re-establishment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	44
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other Nevada regulations govern operating and design standards for the construction and operation of any source of air contamination and landfill operations. Any changes to these laws and regulations could require changes to operating constraints, technical criteria, fees or bonding requirements, and involve substantial cost and management time.
</FONT>

</DIV>

	Revenues (interest income)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="15%" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PX SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	434
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All of our projects are at the exploration stage and, to date, we have not generated any revenues other than interest income.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	At December&#160;31, 2014, we had not yet achieved profitable operations and has accumulated losses of $28,841,501 (December&#160;31, 2013 &#8211; $17,132,864) since inception.&#160;&#160;These losses resulted in a net loss per share (basic and diluted) for the year ended December&#160;31, 2014 of $0.10 (December&#160;31, 2013 - $0.05).
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the quarters ended March&#160;31, 2013, June&#160;30, 2013, March&#160;31, 2014, June&#160;30, 2014, and September&#160;30, 2014, stock options were granted to various parties.&#160;&#160;These grants resulted in share-based compensation expenses of $44,557, $1,149,499, $1,390,376, $81,967, and $730,986 respectively, contributing to significantly higher losses in these quarters compared to quarters in which no stock options were granted.
</FONT>
</DIV>

	Generally speaking, our general and administrative expenses are not subject to increases or decreases due to seasonality. However, given the general weather conditions and exploration season in North Central Nevada, our exploration and evaluation assets expenditures tend to be greater from April to December than in the rest of the year.
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	46
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage58"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE">
	Fourth Quarter
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The operating and administrative expenses for the quarter ended December&#160;31, 2014 totaled $448,364. The major expenses for the quarter ended December&#160;31, 2014 were management fees of $197,085, professional fees of $115,019, office expenses of $60,099, consulting fees of $305,530, travel and related expenses of $198,407, regulatory and shareholder service of $36,313 and wages and salaries of $174,418.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net loss in the three months ended December&#160;31, 2014 was $5,064,837 compared to a net loss of $1,266,413 in the comparative period ended December&#160;31, 2013. The significantly higher net loss experienced in the current period is largely the result of the write down of the Safford-CVN and East Camp Douglas projects totaling $5,988,249 and higher travel and related expenses as we increased the level of site visits and investor meetings in the current period. This increase in expenses was partially offset by an adjustment to share-based compensation and lower consulting fees incurred in connection with developing marketing and financial strategies in Europe compared to the corresponding period in 2013.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On November 3, 2014, we issued 1,250,000 Common Shares at a deemed price of $0.59 per share to Scorpio pursuant to the Pinion Acquisition.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In December 2014, we entered into separate option-to-purchase agreements to acquire an additional 866 net hectares (2,140 net acres) of land at the southern end of the Railroad-Pinion Project including two additional gold occurrences in close proximity to the Pinion Deposit, being Dark Star and Dixie Creek prospects. The total cost of these acquisitions is less than U.S.$163,000 in the first year and about U.S.$65,000 annually thereafter.&#160;&#160;Subsequent to December&#160;31, 2014, we announced a maiden &#8220;inferred&#8221; mineral resource estimate for the Dark Star gold deposit of 23.11 million tonnes grading 0.51 grams per tonne (g/t) gold (Au), totaling 375,000 ounces (oz) of gold, using a cut-off grade of 0.14 g/t Au.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We incurred a total of $19,873, $3,440,741, and $392 in deferred exploration expenses on its CVN, Railroad-Pinion and Camp Douglas Projects, respectively, during the fourth quarter for total deferred exploration costs of $3,461,006.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE">
	Results of Operations
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As an exploration company, we have yet to generate any revenue from our planned operations and have, to date, incurred annual net losses from operating and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The operating and administrative expenses for the year ended December&#160;31, 2014 totaled $5,731,071 (December&#160;31, 2013: $4,263,602), including share-based compensation issued during the period, valued at $1,436,615 (December&#160;31, 2013: $1,194,056) calculated using the Black Scholes option pricing model. Comparatively, the major expenses for the period ended December&#160;31, 2014 were management fees of $678,835 (December&#160;31, 2013 - $688,550), professional fees of $525,813 (December&#160;31, 2013 - $368,168), office expenses of $238,340 (December&#160;31, 2013 - $172,299), consulting fees of $934,498 (December&#160;31, 2013 - $565,954), investor relations of $231,606 (December&#160;31, 2013 - $99,670), regulatory and shareholder services of $193,814 (December&#160;31, 2013 - $117,922) and travel and related costs of $639,322 (December&#160;31, 2013 - $377,957).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;

	Increased due to more activities with respect to the Pinion Acquisition, the March and August 2014 financings, and mineral lease amendments in Nevada.

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our operations consist primarily of the acquisition, maintenance and exploration of exploration and evaluation assets, including actively seeking joint venture partners to assist with exploration funding.&#160;&#160;Any financial success will be dependent on the extent to which we can discover new mineral deposits.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at December&#160;31, 2014, we had a cash and cash equivalents position of $494,878 (December&#160;31, 2013 - $1,221,192) derived from the net proceeds of the August 2014 Financing of 9,850,000 underwritten common shares at a price of U.S.$0.64 (C$0.6991) per share for proceeds $6,068,455 net of cash commissions and expenses of $817,972.&#160;&#160;The net proceeds of the August 2014 financing were used to fund, among other things, the Phase 2 drill program on the Pinion Project and for general corporate and working capital purposes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at December&#160;31, 2014, we had a working capital deficit position of $4,035,579 (December&#160;31, 2013 &#8211; $545,278).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On March&#160;5, 2014, we completed the March 2014 Financing of 15,188,495 units at a price of $0.72 per unit for net proceeds of approximately $10.1&#160;million, after commissions and expenses of approximately $772,256. The net proceeds from the March 2014 financing were used to complete the Pinion Acquisition and for general corporate and working capital purposes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On August&#160;19, 2014, we completed a public offering of 9,850,000 Common Shares at a price of U.S.$0.64 per share for gross proceeds of approximately U.S.$6.3&#160;million. The net proceeds of the August 2014 Financing were used to rectify our working capital deficiency, maintain our property interests in good standing, fund the Phase 2 drill program on the Pinion project and for general corporate and working capital purposes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On February&#160;3, 2015, we completed an additional public offering of 19,032,000 common shares, at a price of U.S.$0.47 per Common Share for gross proceeds of approximately U.S.$8.9&#160;million, and approximately $2&#160;million was used to pay the remainder of the Scorpio Note. However, the net proceeds from this 2015 financing will not be sufficient to fund the full work program recommended in the 2015 Railroad-Pinion Report and we will require additional capital to complete same. There are no assurances that we will be successful in raising additional capital in a timely manner on commercially reasonable terms or at all.&#160;&#160;See Item 3D &#8220;Risks Factors&#8221; above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	49
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage61"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE">
	Tanqueray LOI
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On May 29, 2014, we entered into a binding letter of intent to sell the Safford-CVN and East Camp Douglas Projects to Tanqueray for a combination of cash and common shares of Tanqueray, subject to a number of conditions including, but not limited to, a consolidation of Tanqueray&#8217;s issued common shares on a 3 to 1 basis (the &#8220;Tanqueray Consolidation&#8221;) and Tanqueray completing a concurrent non-brokered private placement financing of not less than $1,500,000 at a price of not less than $0.20 per post-consolidated share (the &#8220;Tanqueray Financing&#8221;). However, due to difficult capital markets for early exploration prospects and Tanqueray&#8217;s inability to raise the Tanqueray Financing, the purchase price for the Safford-CVN and East Camp Douglas Projects has been reduced to $900,000 comprised of a cash payment of $300,000 and 12,000,000 pre-consolidated (4,000,000 post-consolidated) common shares of Tanqueray at a deemed price of $0.05 per pre-consolidated share ($0.15 per post-consolidated share).&#160;&#160;Closing of the amended LOI is now anticipated to occur on or about May 31, 2015, subject to completion of the Tanqueray Consolidation, the Tanqueray Financing and the acceptance of the TSXV. As a result of the reduction in the purchase price for the Safford-CVN and East Camp Douglas Projects, as of December&#160;31, 2014 we have recorded further write-downs of our Safford-CVN and East Camp Douglas Projects of $2,041,714 and $2,545,083, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The proposed sale of the Safford-CVN and East Camp Douglas Projects follows a strategic decision by our Board to concentrate our company&#8217;s efforts on our wholly owned/controlled Railroad-Pinion Project on Nevada&#8217;s Carlin Trend.&#160;&#160;As part of such shift in strategic direction, we also made certain changes to our technical team in 2014. Effective May 30, 2014, co-founder, director and Vice-President, Exploration Dave Mathewson stepped down as a director and officer to assume responsibility for the direction of Tanqueray as its Vice-President, Exploration and interim CEO upon closing of the LOI.&#160;&#160;In conjunction therewith, we paid Mr. Mathewson a transition payment equal to one year&#8217;s salary, being U.S.$220,000, by way of a combination of cash and Common Shares and Mr. Mathewson remains a technical advisor to us for a period of at least one year. Senior Geologist, Mac R. Jackson, Jr., M.Sc. was appointed Gold Standard&#8217;s new Vice-President, Exploration and is joined by, among others, Chief Geologist John Norby, M.Sc.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Divestiture Highlights:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">

	The sale will reduce our annual land holding costs by approximately U.S.$434,000.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	There is no assurance that the sale of the Safford-CVN and East Camp Douglas Projects to Tanqueray will be successfully completed on the terms and conditions set out in the amended LOI or at all.&#160;&#160;In the event the sale does not proceed, we will be required to incur annual expenditures in excess of U.S.$434,000 to maintain the Safford-CVN and East Camp Douglas Projects in good standing.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our continuation as a going concern is dependent upon successful results from our exploration and evaluation activities and our ability to attain profitable operations and generate funds therefrom and/or raise equity capital or borrowings sufficient to meet current and future obligations. Management intends to finance operating costs over the next twelve months with current cash on hand, proceeds from the exercise of stock options and warrants, and further equity financing.&#160;&#160;&#160;There are no assurances that we will be successful in raising additional capital on commercially reasonable terms or at all. See Item 3D &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Risk Factors
</FONT>
	.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On January&#160;1, 2010, we entered into a sublease agreement for an office space in Vancouver, B.C. for a term of 4 years and 3 months expiring March&#160;31, 2014 and incurring monthly rent payments of $6,867 per month. In November 2012, we assumed the lease and became the primary lessee, and the term was extended to April&#160;30, 2015. In January 2015, pursuant to a lease amendment agreement, the term was extended to April&#160;30, 2020.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On September&#160;1, 2011, we entered into a commercial lease agreement for an office space in Elko, Nevada for a term of 36 months expiring August&#160;30, 2014, incurring a monthly rent payment of U.S.$4,400.&#160;&#160;In September 2014, we exercised the renewal option to extend the term for 12 months expiring August&#160;30, 2015, incurring a monthly rent payment of U.S.$4,635.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In March 2011, we entered into four separate consulting agreements with consultants, officers, and directors to provide us with management consulting and exploration services for an indefinite term effective January&#160;1, 2011 and one consulting agreement with an officer and director to provide us with management/administrative consulting services for an indefinite term effective February 1, 2011.&#160;&#160;During 2012, the board of directors approved certain increases to these consulting agreements such that the total combined payments are currently $72,583 per month. In May 2014, a director and officer resigned from his position, and as such the related consulting agreement was terminated. The termination of the consulting agreement reduced the monthly required payment by $18,333. We agreed to pay a total resignation payment of $239,910 to this director and officer, by way of a combination of cash and Common Shares. These agreements also provide for a two year payout totaling, on a collective basis, approximately $1,528,420 (including average discretionary bonuses paid in 2013 and 2014) in the event of termination without cause and a three year payout totaling, on a collective basis, (including average discretionary bonuses paid in 2013 and 2014) approximately $2,292,630 in the event of termination following a change in control of our company.&#160;&#160;See Item 6B &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Directors, Senior Management and Employees-Compensation.
</FONT>
	&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

	&#160;

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Jonathan T. Awde
</FONT>
	(age 37) has been our President and Chief Executive Officer since July 2010 upon the acquisition of JKR, and President and Chief Executive Officer of JKR since March 2009, of which he was a co-founder.&#160;&#160;Mr. Awde is the person primarily responsible for the implementation and execution of the Company&#8217;s business plan and operations.&#160;&#160;Mr. Awde holds a Bachelor of Arts (Economics and Finance) from Acadia University in Nova Scotia (1999) and is a former sales and trading professional at Wolverton Securities Inc.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	David M. Cole
</FONT>
	(age 53) has been a director since March 2012.&#160;&#160;Mr. Cole has more than 27 years of mining and mineral exploration industry experience.&#160;&#160;In December 2003, he founded Eurasian Minerals Inc. (&#8220;Eurasian Minerals&#8221;), as a public company listed on the NYSE-MKT (EMXX) and TSXV
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	(EMX)
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	and serves as its President and Chief Executive Officer. In March 2004, Mr. Cole co-founded Standard Uranium Corporation, a public uranium exploration and development company which was later sold to Energy Metals Corporation. From 1992 to 2003, Mr. Cole worked for Newmont Mining Corporation (&#8220;Newmont&#8221;) where he held a number of management and senior geologic positions, gaining extensive global business and technical experience.&#160;&#160;Mr. Cole&#8217;s success as part of Newmont&#8217;s exploration team includes contributions at the world class Carlin Trend (Nevada, USA), Yanacocha (Peru), and Minihasa (Indonesia) mines. Subsequently, he established and managed Newmont&#8217;s exploration programs in Turkey.&#160;&#160;Mr. Cole earned his Master&#8217;s Degree from Colorado State University in 1991 and is a member of several professional organizations and local and international societies, such as the Society of Economic Geologists and the American Mining, Metallurgical and Petroleum Engineers.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Mac R. Jackson, Jr.
</FONT>
	(age 54) has been our Vice President-Exploration&#160;&#160;since May 2014, having joined us in July&#160;2011. He has more than 17 years of experience as an exploration geologist, including eight years with Newmont Mining Corporation.&#160;&#160;During his tenure with Newmont, Mr. Jackson was a significant contributor to the discovery of the West Leeville and Turf deposits, both of which are on the Carlin Trend, and the Fiber Line deposit at the Twin Creeks complex.&#160;&#160;Mr. Jackson is a certified professional geologist (CPG - 11661) with the American Institute of Professional Geologists (2014) and holds a Master of Science degree from the University of Nevada (1988).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Robert J. McLeod
</FONT>
	(age&#160;44) has been a director since June 2011, having previously served as a director from July 2010 to March 2011. Mr. McLeod has been the Chief Executive Officer, Vice-President, Operations and a director of Full Metal Minerals Corp., a junior exploration company listed on the TSXV, since June 2003.&#160;&#160;He is also a director of various other publicly listed companies including Revolution Resources Corp. (TSX&#8211;RV), Vendetta Mining Corp. (TSXV&#8211;VDT) and Entourage Metals Ltd. (TSXV-EMT), and from February 2003 to February 2004, he was Vice-President, Exploration for Atna Resources Ltd. (TSX-ATN).&#160;&#160;From 2000 to 2003, Mr. McLeod was a Project Geologist for Miramar Mining Corp. and from 1998 to 2000, he was a Senior Geologist for Grayd Resource Corporation.&#160;&#160;Mr. McLeod is a professional geologist (March 2003) with a Master&#8217;s of Science, Geology, from Queens University, Kingston, Ontario (1998) and a Bachelors of Science, Geology, from the University of British Columbia (1993).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Richard S. Silas
</FONT>
	(age&#160;44) has been our Secretary and a director since July 2010 and April 2009, respectively, having served as President and Chief Executive Officer from August 2009 to July 2010.&#160;&#160;Mr. Silas is the President of Universal Solutions Inc., a private company providing management and administrative services to TSXV listed companies, and has served as a director and/or officer of various other publicly traded companies over the past 15 years. Mr. Silas also holds a certificate (securities program) from Simon Fraser University in British Columbia.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Jamie D. R. Strauss
</FONT>
	(age 45) has been a director since September 2012.&#160;&#160;Mr. Strauss is currently a director of a boutique mining finance firm, Strauss Partners, based in London, England and has worked as a stockbroker in the City of London for 25 years, specializing in the corporate resource arena, including a term as Managing Director of UK for BMO Capital Markets from 2007 to 2009. He has raised capital for projects spanning the globe in both the energy and mineral world on behalf of leading institutions in North America, Australia and Europe and was a committee member of the Association of Mining Analysts for six years until resigning in 2010.&#160;&#160;Mr. Strauss is also a non-executive director of Wildhorse Energy Ltd. (AIM, ASX) and Altius Minerals Corporation (TSXV-ALS).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	William E. Threlkeld
</FONT>
	(age 59) has been a director since March 2011.&#160;&#160;He has been the designee of FCMI Parent Co. (see Item 7A &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Major Shareholders
</FONT>
	&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Since 2001, he has been a Senior Vice President of Seabridge Gold, Inc. where he is responsible for, among other things, designing and executing exploration and resource delineation programs. From 1997 to 2000, he was Vice-President, Exploration, for Greenstone Resources Ltd., responsible for resource delineation on three Central American gold deposits and development of an organization and strategy to identify new mineral investments.&#160;&#160;From 1991 to 1997, he was a Vice President and Exploration Manager at Placer Dome Inc. where he was responsible for its exploration activity and investment in South America. Mr. Threlkeld obtained a Master of Science in Economic Geology from the University of Western Ontario.
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	$222,867
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_COMPENSATION_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	1
</FONT>
	&#160;&#160;631208 B.C. Ltd., a private company controlled by Jonathan T. Awde, currently receives a management fee of $220,000 per annum, plus discretionary bonus (2014 - $54,650), in consideration for providing management services to our company.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	2
</FONT>
	Michael Waldkirch &amp; Company Inc., a private company controlled by Michael N. Waldkirch, receives the sum of $163,000 per annum, plus discretionary bonus (2014 - $18,150), in consideration for providing general accounting and financial management services to our company.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	3
</FONT>
	In conjunction with a shift in focus from exploration towards resource delineation and development, we made certain changes to our technical team.&#160;&#160;Effective May 30, 2014, co-founder, director and Vice-President, Exploration David&#160;C. Mathewson stepped down as a director and officer to assume responsibility for the direction of Tanqueray as its Vice-President, Exploration and interim President and CEO. In conjunction therewith, we paid Mr. Mathewson a transition payment equal to one year&#8217;s salary, being U.S.$220,000, by way of a combination of cash and Common Shares and Mr. Mathewson remains a technical advisor to us for a period of at least one year. Senior Geologist, Mac R. Jackson, Jr., M.Sc. was appointed as our new Vice-President, Exploration.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	plus discretionary bonus (2014 - $17,035), in consideration for providing general administrative services to our company.

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">

<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE">
	Stock Option Plan
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In July 2010, we adopted our current stock option plan (the &#8220;2010 Stock Option Plan&#8221;) covering the grant of stock options for the purchase of Common Shares by our directors, officers, employees and consultants.&#160;&#160;It is a &#8220;rolling plan&#8221; which permits us to reserve for issuance up to a maximum of 10% of our issued and outstanding Common Shares from time to time.&#160;&#160;The 2010 Stock Option Plan restricts the number of options that may be granted to any single optionee during any 12 month period to a maximum of 5% of our issued shares (2% in the case of consultants) and the exercise price of any options may not be less than the closing price of our Common Shares on the trading day preceding the date of grant, less applicable discounts as permitted by the policies of the TSXV.&#160;&#160;Options may be granted for terms of up to ten years, subject to earlier termination on certain events, and exercisable while the optionee is associated with us and for a period of up to one year after cessation of such association for specified reasons.&#160;&#160;Vesting restrictions, if any, are determined by the Board of Directors at the time of grant, subject to acceleration of vesting on certain events.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE">
	Compensation Agreements
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In March 2011, we entered into compensation agreements with the four Named Executive Officers.&#160;&#160;Each compensation agreement was effective from either January&#160;1, 2011 or February 1, 2011 and for an indefinite term, subject to termination upon the happening of certain events including the death or permanent disability of the Named Executive Officer or a material breach by either party of its obligations under the agreement.&#160;&#160;With respect to Messrs. Awde, Silas and Waldkirch, we have entered into consulting&#160;&#160;agreements with their individual consulting companies, which in each case, has agreed to make the services of their respective principal available to us as a corporate officer.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The annual base fees payable to the individual consulting companies of Messrs. Awde, Silas and Waldkirch are $220,000, $134,000 and $163,000, respectively, plus Canadian goods and services tax, and with discretionary bonuses.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE">
	Pension Plan Benefits
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We do not have any pension plan that provides for payments or benefits to the Named Executive Officers at, following, or in connection with retirement
</FONT>
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE">
	Termination and Change of Control Benefits
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The compensation agreements mentioned above with the Named Executive Officers also include similar termination and change of control benefits, based upon each Named Executive Officer&#8217;s respective annual base fee/salary plus bonus levels.&#160;&#160;In the event we terminate a Named Executive Officer&#8217;s consulting/employment relationship without cause, as defined, the Named Executive Officer would be entitled to receive a termination payment equal to two times his annual base fee/salary plus bonus.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, each Named Executive Officer is entitled to terminate his engagement with us and receive a termination payment equal to three times his annual base fee/salary plus bonus if: (i) there is a &#8220;change of control&#8221; of the Company; and (ii) a specified &#8220;trigger event&#8221; occurs, provided that the Named Executive Officer exercises such termination right within 180 days from the triggering event.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A &#8220;change of control&#8221; includes (i) a shareholder acquiring a 20% voting interest in us, (ii) the completion of a merger or similar transaction whereby all or part of our outstanding voting shares are changed, reclassified, converted into or exchanged for other securities of us or another entity or for cash or other property, (iii) sales of substantial amounts of our assets or (iv) certain changes in the composition of our Board.&#160;&#160;A &#8220;triggering event&#8221; includes (i) a substantial change in the nature of the services to be performed by the Named Executive Officer, (ii) a material reduction of his base fee/salary or other form of compensation, (iii) a material breach of the agreement by us, (iv) a change in the city where he regularly carries out his duties and (v) a successor company fails to effectively assume our obligations under his compensation agreement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE">
	Director Compensation
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	David M. Cole, Robert J. McLeod and Jamie D. R. Strauss, as our non-executive directors, each receive annual directors&#8217; fees of $24,000 ($2,000 per month) in consideration for their services as directors.&#160;&#160;William E. Threlkeld, who has been FCMI Parent Co.&#8217;s nominee director on the Board since March 2011 (see Item 7A
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#8220;Major Shareholders&#8221;
</FONT>
	), has voluntarily waived payment of this fee.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Board Practices
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Directors are elected at each annual general meeting and hold office until the next annual general meeting or until their successors are appointed.&#160;&#160;The directors listed in Item 6A &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Directors, Senior Management and Employees
</FONT>
	&#8221;&#160;were elected at our 2014 annual shareholders meeting held on September 9, 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our Audit Committee consists of three directors, being Messrs. McLeod (Chair), Cole, and Threlkeld, each of whom is considered &#8220;independent&#8221; for purposes of this Committee.&#160;&#160;All the members of the Audit Committee have the ability to read and understand financial statements that present a breadth and level of complexity of accounting issues that are generally comparable to the breadth and complexity of the issues that can reasonably be expected to be raised by our financial statements.&#160;&#160;The Audit Committee Charter provides that the purposes of this Committee are to (i) provide an open avenue of communication between management, our external auditor and the Board, (ii) assist the Board in its oversight of the integrity, adequacy and timeliness of our financial reporting and disclosure practices, compliance with legal and regulatory requirements related to financial reporting and the independence and performance of the external auditors, and (iii) perform any other activities consistent with its Charter and governing laws as the Committee or the Board deems necessary or appropriate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	57
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our Compensation Committee consists of three directors, being Messrs. McLeod (Chair), Cole and Threlkeld.&#160;&#160;This Committee was formed in March 2011 for the purpose of making recommendations to the Board regarding executive compensation (including philosophy and programs) and compensation of members of the Board.&#160;&#160;The Board as a whole is responsible for determining the final compensation, including stock option grants and other long-term benefits.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our Nominating Committee consists of three directors, being Messrs. Strauss (Chair), McLeod and Awde.&#160;&#160;This Committee was formed in April 2014 for the purpose of assisting the Board in developing our approach to the nomination of directors including, but not limited to, identifying candidates for nomination as a director and recommending qualified director candidates for election at the next annual meeting of shareholders.&#160;&#160;This Committee is establishing a long-term plan for the composition of the Board.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our Corporate Governance Committee consists of three directors, being Messrs. McLeod (Chair), Strauss and Threlkeld.&#160;&#160;This Committee was formed in April 2014 for the purpose of developing and supervising our approach to corporate governance issues including, but not limited to, the Board committees, orientation and educational programs for directors and reviewing annually our corporate governance policies and procedures and making recommendations to the Board with respect to them.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our Board has adopted a Code of Conduct regarding the expectations of the directors when acting in such position.&#160;&#160;The Board as a whole will enforce the Code of Conduct.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

Awde, Silas and Waldkirch, all of whom are based in Vancouver, B.C.&#160;&#160;See Item 6B &#8220;

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.5PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&#160;&#160;On March&#160;3, 2011, FCMI Parent Co. (&#8220;FCMI&#8221;) acquired, by way of private placement, a total of 11,000,000 Common Shares at a price of $0.95 per share for a gross purchase price of $10,450,000. FCMI is a private company based in Toronto, Ontario and controlled by Albert D. Friedberg and members of his family. Under the terms of its subscription agreement and subject to FCMI beneficially owning not less than ten (10%) percent of the issued and outstanding Common Shares, FCMI had the right, which expired on March&#160;3, 2013, to (a) nominate one member to the Board, and (b) participate, on a pro rata basis, in any future equity financing undertaken by the company (excluding stock options granted pursuant to the company&#8217;s stock option plan and then outstanding share purchase warrants)
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	.
</FONT>
	William E. Threlkeld is FCMI&#8217;s nominee on the Board.&#160;&#160;On March 4, 2014, FCMI acquired an additional 1,944,444 units of our company at a price of $0.72 per unit in connection with the 2014 private placement.&#160;&#160;On August 19, 2014, FCMI acquired an additional 1,300,000 Common Shares at a price of U.S.$0.64 per share for an aggregate purchase price of U.S.$832,000 pursuant to the 2014 public offering.&#160;&#160;On February 3, 2015, FCMI acquired an additional 11,400,000 Common Shares at a price of U.S.$0.47 per share for an aggregate purchase price of U.S.$5,358,000 pursuant to the 2015 public offering.&#160;&#160;Based on Amendment No. 6 to Schedule 13D filed by FCMI on February 10, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.5PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

	United States Shareholders.
</FONT>
	&#160;&#160;Based upon the records of Computershare Investor Services, Inc., our transfer agent, as of April 29, 2015, there were 25 registered holders of our Common Shares in the United States, with combined holdings of 4,775,196 shares, representing approximately 4.25% of the outstanding Common Shares.&#160;&#160;We do not know how many beneficial shareholders we have in the United States, but management believes there are less than 300 such shareholders.

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our Common Shares have been listed and traded on the TSXV since January 7, 2005, and currently trade under the symbol &#8220;GSV.&#8221;&#160;&#160;From December 8, 2010 through June 11, 2012, our Common Shares were traded in the United States on the OTCQX International under trading symbol &#8220;GDVXF,&#8221; and since June 12, 2012 they have been listed and traded on the NYSE MKT under the trading symbol &#8220;GSV.&#8221;&#160;&#160;The CUSIP number for our Common Shares is 380738104.
</FONT>

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
